title: Build Sequence: PRD-001 (Part 2 of 7)
buildPhilosophy: Generated using dependency-first strategy. Each FBS represents a testable, deployable increment.

buildSequence.title: Job Data Quality & Error Handling
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive error handling, data validation, and quality assurance for job extraction processes. Provides retry mechanisms, encoding detection, and extraction metadata tracking to ensure reliable data processing.
testableOutcomes: System logs extraction errors and continues processing other extractable fields when encountering malformed job listings
System detects and corrects character encoding problems in job listing content
System flags job records with missing critical fields for manual review during validation
System identifies and marks duplicate job listings based on title, company, and description similarity
System retries extraction up to 3 times before marking listings as failed when processing errors occur
System includes extraction metadata with source, timestamp, and confidence scores when storing successful extractions
System maintains processing statistics and error rates for monitoring data quality
System validates extracted data against schema requirements before storage

deliverables: Extraction error handler with retry logic
Data validation framework with quality checks

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Focus on graceful degradation and comprehensive logging. Implement circuit breaker patterns for external dependencies and ensure extraction failures don't cascade to system failures.

buildSequence.title: Job Deduplication System
buildSequence.summary: Implements intelligent job deduplication with title and company normalization, completeness scoring, and edge case handling. Provides automatic duplicate detection during discovery and ensures only unique, most complete job listings are presented to users.
testableOutcomes: System identifies job listings as duplicates when they have identical titles and company names after case-insensitive comparison
System normalizes job titles by removing whitespace and punctuation differences before duplicate comparison
System normalizes company names by handling case differences and common suffixes before duplicate comparison
System flags jobs from different platforms as duplicates when normalized title and company match
System does not identify jobs as duplicates when they have different titles but same company
System does not identify jobs as duplicates when they have same title but different companies
System retains job listing with description when deduplicating against listing without description
System retains job listing with salary information when deduplicating against listing without salary
System retains job listing with location details when deduplicating against listing without location
System retains most recently discovered listing when duplicate completeness scores are equal
System calculates completeness scores based on presence of description, salary, location, requirements, and benefits
System marks discarded duplicate listings with reference to retained listing
System excludes duplicate listings from search results and shows only retained versions
System reflects only unique job listings in search result counts
System handles null or empty titles and company names without incorrect duplicate matching
System correctly processes special characters and unicode in titles and company names during duplicate detection

deliverables: Duplicate detection algorithm with similarity scoring
Edge case handling for null/empty values

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Implement fuzzy matching algorithms for robust duplicate detection. Consider using string similarity libraries and ensure performance optimization for large datasets. Design database indexes to support efficient duplicate queries.

buildSequence.title: Job Data Normalization
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive data normalization for job listings including country names, technology names, salary currency conversion, and experience level categorization. Processes job data in batches with error handling and reporting capabilities.
testableOutcomes: System normalizes 'USA' to 'United States' and 'UK' to 'United Kingdom' in job location data
System maps 'React.js' and 'ReactJS' to standardized 'React' in technology requirements
System converts EUR and GBP salary amounts to USD equivalent using current exchange rates
System categorizes '0-2 years experience' as 'Entry Level' and '6+ years' as 'Senior Level'
System processes 100 job records through normalization pipeline within 30 seconds
System generates summary report showing counts of successfully normalized vs failed records after batch processing

deliverables: Currency conversion service with exchange rate API

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires external exchange rate API integration, comprehensive mapping tables for countries and technologies, and robust error handling for batch processing failures.

buildSequence.title: Job Filtering & Search System
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive job filtering capabilities including country, technology, salary range, remote work, and experience level filters. Supports multiple simultaneous filters with real-time result updates and empty state handling.
testableOutcomes: User can select multiple countries and see jobs from any selected country displayed using OR logic
User can select technologies and see only jobs requiring at least one selected technology
User can set minimum and maximum salary values to filter jobs within specified range
User can enable remote-only toggle to see exclusively fully remote positions
User can select experience levels and see jobs matching any selected level
User can apply multiple filter types simultaneously and see jobs meeting all criteria
System displays appropriate empty results message when filter combinations yield no matches
System validates salary range inputs and shows error when minimum exceeds maximum

deliverables: Empty state and no results handling
Filter UI components and state management

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Complex filter combination logic requires careful performance optimization for database queries. Real-time updates need efficient state management to prevent excessive API calls.

buildSequence.title: Advanced Filtering & Preferences
buildSequence.summary: Implements persistent filter preferences that save and restore user selections across sessions. Provides seamless user experience with automatic preference restoration and default settings for new users.
testableOutcomes: User's filter selections persist when navigating away from job search page and returning
User's filter preferences are restored after logging out and logging back in
User can modify existing filter preferences and changes are saved for future sessions
New users see default filter settings when first accessing the job search page
System maintains filter state consistency across browser sessions and page refreshes

deliverables: Filter preference storage and retrieval API

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Straightforward implementation building on existing filter system. Main considerations are data migration for existing users and handling preference conflicts between sessions.

buildSequence.title: CV Upload & Processing Foundation
buildSequence.summary: Establishes core CV file upload functionality with validation, file processing, and error handling. Supports PDF and DOCX formats with size limits and provides comprehensive upload status feedback.
testableOutcomes: User can upload PDF files under 5MB and receive confirmation message
User can upload DOCX files under 5MB and receive confirmation message
System rejects files over 5MB with error message 'File size must be under 5MB'
System rejects non-PDF/DOCX files with error message 'Only PDF and DOCX files are supported'
User receives appropriate error message when upload fails due to network issues
User can retry failed uploads after receiving error message
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Requires secure file storage, virus scanning consideration, and robust error handling for various file corruption scenarios. Integration with existing authentication system needed.

buildSequence.title: CV Data Extraction & Analysis
buildSequence.summary: Implements comprehensive CV text extraction and AI-powered data analysis to identify skills, experience, and education information. Provides parsing accuracy validation and user feedback mechanisms.
testableOutcomes: System extracts text from PDF files with at least 95% accuracy
System extracts text from DOCX files with at least 95% accuracy
System preserves special characters and maintains logical reading order from multi-column layouts
System identifies and extracts programming languages, frameworks, databases, and cloud platforms from CV text
System normalizes skill variations (React.js/ReactJS to React) to standard terms
System calculates total work experience duration correctly handling overlapping periods and current employment
System extracts degree information, institutions, graduation dates, and certifications
User can view organized parsing results with confidence scores for extracted information
User can edit incorrect or missing information and save corrections
System flags uncertain extractions and prompts user review when accuracy is below 95%
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Heavy dependency on AI model performance for accurate extraction. Requires comprehensive skills taxonomy and robust date parsing. Consider fallback mechanisms for AI service unavailability.

buildSequence.title: User Profile Management
buildSequence.summary: Provides comprehensive user profile creation and management functionality including job search preferences, target countries, technology skills, salary expectations, and experience level configuration with validation.
testableOutcomes: User can create profile with target countries, technologies, salary expectations, experience level, and remote preference
User can view and edit all previously saved profile preferences
System validates profile requiring at least one target country before saving
User can search and select from searchable list of countries with autocomplete
User can search and select technologies with autocomplete suggestions and custom skill addition
System validates salary inputs requiring numeric values and preventing minimum > maximum
User can select experience level and enter years of experience with validation
User can set remote-only preference and system filters non-remote jobs accordingly
System displays clear validation messages for missing required fields
User with incomplete profile is redirected to complete profile before accessing job features
Profile updates are immediately available for job matching algorithm
buildSequence.implementationNotes: Straightforward CRUD operations with form validation. Requires integration with existing filter system and job matching algorithm. Consider profile migration strategy for schema updates.

buildSequence.title: Job Match Scoring Foundation
buildSequence.summary: Implements a comprehensive hybrid match scoring system that calculates job relevance scores using TF-IDF text similarity, skill overlap, experience matching, and semantic embeddings. Provides weighted scoring algorithm with configurable component weights and robust error handling for missing data.
testableOutcomes: System calculates final match scores between 0-100% for any job posting and user profile combination
TF-IDF component contributes exactly 30% to final match score calculation
Skill overlap component contributes exactly 40% to final match score calculation
Experience match component contributes exactly 20% to final match score calculation
Semantic embeddings component contributes exactly 10% to final match score calculation
System returns 100% TF-IDF similarity score when comparing identical text content
System returns near 0% TF-IDF similarity score when comparing completely unrelated text
System excludes common stopwords from TF-IDF similarity calculations
System assigns higher weights to rare terms than common terms in TF-IDF calculations
System returns 100% skill overlap when user possesses all required job skills
System returns 0% skill overlap when user has no matching job skills
System performs case-insensitive skill matching for overlap calculations
System recognizes common skill aliases (JavaScript/JS, React.js/ReactJS) as matches
System returns 100% experience match when user experience exactly matches job requirements
System reduces experience match score when user is significantly overqualified
System defaults experience match to 75% when job has no specified requirements
System calculates semantic similarity scores between 0-100% using cosine similarity on embedding vectors
System defaults skill overlap to 50% when job posting has missing skill requirements
System defaults experience match to 50% when user profile has missing experience information
System defaults TF-IDF to 25% when job description has insufficient text for analysis
System defaults semantic embeddings to 25% when embedding generation fails
System logs errors and continues calculation with default values when any component fails

deliverables: Match scoring service with hybrid algorithm implementation
TF-IDF similarity calculator with stopword filtering
Skill overlap analyzer with alias recognition
Experience matching engine with overqualification handling
Semantic embeddings service with cosine similarity
Weighted score combiner with configurable weights
Error handling and default value system
Unit tests for all scoring components

buildSequence.implementationNotes: High complexity due to multiple AI/ML components including TF-IDF vectorization, semantic embeddings, and weighted scoring algorithms. Requires integration with AI client for embeddings and robust error handling for production reliability.

buildSequence.title: Match Score Visualization & Error Handling
buildSequence.summary: Provides detailed match score breakdown visualization showing individual component contributions and implements comprehensive error handling for edge cases. Creates user-friendly interfaces for understanding match calculations and ensures system reliability when data is incomplete.
testableOutcomes: User can view TF-IDF component score with 30% weighting displayed in job details
User can view skill overlap component score with 40% weighting displayed in job details
User can view experience match component score with 20% weighting displayed in job details
User can view semantic embeddings component score with 10% weighting displayed in job details
System displays component score breakdown where sum of weighted components equals total match score
Match score breakdown UI shows visual indicators for each component's contribution
System provides tooltips explaining what each scoring component measures
User can expand/collapse detailed scoring breakdown for any job listing
Match score visualization updates in real-time when user profile changes
System displays error messages when match score calculation fails partially
System shows which components used default values due to missing data

deliverables: Score visualization charts and progress bars

buildSequence.implementationNotes: Medium complexity focused on UI/UX implementation. Requires careful design of score visualization to be intuitive and informative without overwhelming users. Error handling must gracefully degrade when scoring components fail.
